alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 13 at 4:22PM PST until January 14 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Rogue River at Eagle Point affecting Jackson County zone. .Heavy rainfall earlier today has resulted in flooding of streams and creeks around the area. Runoff will cause the river to rise quickly this evening, peaking overnight before falling rapidly early Sunday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rogue River at Eagle Point. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, expect flooding of low-lying farm and pastureland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM PST Saturday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. The river will rise quickly this evening and is forecast to peak around 9.0 feet overnight before falling Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM PST.
